description: {"blocks":[{"key":"arhe8","text":"Samples for histological analyses are often formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) and slide-mounted. This complicates RNA extraction for molecular downstream applications. Additionally, when the region of interest is limited to a smaller area with laser microdissection (LMD), extracting adequate quality and quantity RNA is difficult. This is a protocol for maximized RNA output from FFPE tissue devised to identify and analyze gene expression of human maternal uterine scar tissue obtained from uterotomy scars resulting from prior cesarean deliveries. Gomori Trichrome staining allowed for region identification for LMD. Successful RNA isolation, reverse transcription, and quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR) were performed. This description provides an optimized step-by-step protocol that yields sufficient RNA for qRT-PCR analyses from challenging tissue such as LMD-FFPE samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 1: Sample Collection

Mark the scarred area e.g. with cauter points. Place the uterotomy 1 cm above the identified scar).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 1: Sample Collection
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ulhc","text":"Cut out small piece of uterine tissue containing healthy myometrium and scarred area after child is born and before intravenous oxytocin application.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 1: Sample Collection

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7m7ud","text":" dissolve in microwave at 560W (boil until bubbles appear)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pv4b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8bk4v","text":" Let it cool down for approx. 10 minutes (swirl carefully) to 50-60 ° C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec89k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eu3mo","text":"Solution should now be clear (otherwise boil again)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24f7v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"49udf","text":"Add 10µl ethydium bromide (1µl per 10mL gel) to the cooled solution (do not boil)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c19du","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2cvad","text":"Stir with a stir bar or by swirling -\u003e liquid gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c7nmk","text":"Pour out the gel, make sure that there are no air bubbles in it (if necessary, use a pipette tip to remove it)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1gnr2","text":"Insert the comb (0.5-1cm away from the upper edge)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"201im","text":"Let it harden for approx. 1 hour until it is slightly milky → pour TAE Buffer (1X) over it → remove comb","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 12: Gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c45lb","text":"Load the first pocket with 6µl of the dna ladder (marker) (should have the same volume as samples)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oe20","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5f29m","text":"Load further pockets with 6µl mixture of 5µl PCR sample and 1µl loading buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dedg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 9: Control of RNA Integrity (Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer, Nano Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a6aia","text":"Press down the syringe until it is held by the clip →  wait 30s → then loosen the clip and hold for 5s (note: hold the syringe well as it moves back to its original position due to the negative pressure) → slowly draw back to 1mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"as8rd","text":"Apply 5µl of RNA marker (marked green) to all 12 sample wells and the ladder well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 9: Control of RNA Integrity (Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer, Nano Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8jdap","text":"Apply 1µl of ladder to ladder well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5093q","text":"Transfer 1µl of RNA sample to each of the 12 sample wells. Pipette 1 µl of RNA marker into free wells without samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 9: Control of RNA Integrity (Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer, Nano Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3bame","text":"Vortex the chip at 2400 rpm for 1 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Step 9: Control of RNA Integrity (Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer, Nano Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7u42d","text":"Open the software 2100 Expert","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aph6k","text":"Clean with H2O after measurement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
